name: Name

geolocation.true: The plugin will try to get the user's current location using geolocation. If it is not possible you will use the coordinates provided in locationLat and locationLon parameters.
geolocation.false: The plugin will use only the coordinates provided in locationLat and locationLon parameters.

locationLat: Provide the location of latitude which to get the weather.
locationLatLonLink: How to get latitude and longitude of a location
locationLon: Provide the location of longitude which to get the weather.
linkGetLatLon: Visit the following website to find the desired location and get the latitude and longitude:

plugin.description: jQuery plugin that displays the weather forecast for Brazilian cities.
plugin.add-css-1: Now we will include the CSS and Javascript files. You can get the files in the folder
plugin.add-css-2: of the file you downloaded manually or through the package manager.
plugin.add-css-3: Include the CSS at the top of your page in the tag
plugin.add-css-4: Include Javascript at the bottom of your page before tag closes
plugin.add-css-5: Make sure that the jQuery that is required by the plugin is also loaded.
plugin.add-css-6: If you already use jQuery on your page, make sure it is loaded before
plugin.add-css-8: is not compatible with the plugin.
plugin.add-css-9: Running the plugin. Just choose the element where it will insert the content.

pathFolderLocales.default: The plugin will look for the local folder in the same directory where the plugin was installed.
pathFolderLocales.description: If you put the translations in another directory please provide the same.
